page.title: 13FRIDAY, JULY 5TH 1985
page.content: The family living at home consists of Mr.& Mrs. Green, Francesca and Rachel, the 3rd and 4th daughters. Mr. Green is 41 and a metal broker. After rising his wife drove him to Little Chalfont and Latimer station to catch the train to Aldgate. He arrived 10 minutes late to find the tin market was quiet. At 10.30 he had an appointment with his solicitors, which lasted 1 hour, after which he went to the London Metal Exchange on business. He had lunch in the West End with the Assistant Buffet Stock Manager of the International Tin Council. He spent the afternoon at the Metal Exchange and then returned to the office. He returned home, had supper, played golf and watched TV before going to bed. Mrs. Green, who is 45, spent her day washing, doing housework & shopping.
